text:
The Prime Minister of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka (;) is the most senior member of parliament in the cabinet of ministers in Sri Lanka. They are in charge for their policies and actions to parliament. The President is both head of state and head of government in Sri Lanka. Since 1978, most prime ministers have served as mere deputies to the executive presidency, while at times served as the "de-facto" head of government.
On 21 November 2019, Mahinda Rajapaksa was appointed as the Prime Minister by his brother Gotabaya Rajapaksa.
Living former Prime Ministers.
The most recent death of a former Prime Minister was that of D. M. Jayaratne (2010–2015) on 18 November 2019, aged 88.
